starwars

Class SWActor

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Entity
      • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.Actor<SWActionInterface>
        • starwars.SWActor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntityInterface, SWEntityInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Droid, GeneralAckbar, Humanoid, MonMothma, StormTrooper, SWForceActor, TestActor, TuskenRaider

    public abstract class SWActor
extends Actor<SWActionInterface>
implements SWEntityInterface
    Abstrct Class for SWActor The SWActor class describes those actors (Droids, player, Tusken Raiderese, Bens) that whose inherited class comes from. All SWActors have a team, health, hitpoints and so forth. All actors aswell have methods that can be called for any actor - despite the subclass that they are instansiated from.*

      • team

        private Team team
        the Team to which this SWActor belongs to

      • hitpoints

        private int hitpoints
        The amount of hitpoints of this actor. If the hitpoints are zero or less this Actor is dead

        The world this SWActor belongs to.

        Scheduler to schedule this SWActor's events

      • itemCarried

        private SWEntityInterface itemCarried
        The item carried by this SWActor. itemCarried is null if this SWActor is not carrying an item

      • isWielding

        private boolean isWielding
        The item carried by this SWActor may also be wielded. isWielded is false if this SWActor is not wielding the carried item, or cannot

      • humanControlled

        protected boolean humanControlled
        If or not this SWActor is human controlled. SWActors are not human controlled by default

        A string symbol that represents this SWActor, suitable for display

    • Constructor Detail

      • SWActor

        public SWActor(Team team,
               int hitpoints,
               MessageRenderer m,
               SWWorld world)
        Constructor for the SWActor.

        The constructor initializes the actions list of this SWActor.

        By default,

        • All SWActors can be attacked.
        • Have their symbol set to '@'
        Parameters:
        team - to which this SWActor belongs to
        hitpoints - initial hitpoints of this SWActor to start with
        m - message renderer for this SWActor to display messages
        world - the World to which SWActor belongs to
        See Also:
        team, hitpoints, world, Attack

      • getItemCarried

        public SWEntityInterface getItemCarried()
        Returns the item carried by this SWActor.

        This method only returns the reference of the item carried and does not remove the item held from this SWActor.

        If this SWActor is not carrying an item this method will return null.

        Returns:
        the item carried by this SWActor or null if no item is held by this SWActor
        See Also:
        itemCarried

      • isWielding

        public boolean isWielding()
        Returns the status of wield by this SWActor.

        If this SWActor is unable to wield the item (lightsaber) itll be false

        Returns:
        the item carried by this SWActor or null if no item is held by this SWActor
        See Also:
        itemCarried

      • setTeam

        public void setTeam(Team team)
        Sets the team of this SWActor to a new team team.

        Useful when the SWActor's team needs to change dynamically during the simulation. For example, a bite from an evil actor makes a good actor bad.

        Parameters:
        team - the new team of this SWActor
        See Also:
        team

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage(int damage)
        Method insists damage on this SWActor by reducing a certain amount of damage from this SWActor's hitpoints
        Specified by:
        takeDamage in interface SWEntityInterface
        Parameters:
        damage - the amount of hitpoints to be reduced

      • setItemCarried

        public void setItemCarried(SWEntityInterface target)
        Assigns this SWActor's itemCarried to a new item target

        This method will replace items already held by the SWActor with the target. A null target would signify that this SWActor is not carrying an item anymore.

        Parameters:
        target - the new item to be set as item carried
        See Also:
        itemCarried

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Returns true if this SWActor is dead, false otherwise.

        A SWActor is dead when it's hitpoints are less than or equal to zero (0)

        Returns:
        true if and only if this SWActor is dead, false otherwise
        See Also:
        hitpoints

      • isHumanControlled

        public boolean isHumanControlled()
        Returns if or not this SWActor is human controlled.

        Human controlled SWActors' SWActions are selected by the user as commands from the Views.

        Returns:
        true if the SWActor is controlled by a human, false otherwise
        See Also:
        humanControlled

      • hasCapability

        public boolean hasCapability(Capability c)
        hasCapability() method Returns the boolean describing if this SWActor has a certain Capability
        Specified by:
        hasCapability in interface SWEntityInterface

        Returns:
        true if this Capability c is manifested, false otherwise
        See Also:
        Capability

      • resetMoveCommands

        public void resetMoveCommands(Location loc)
        This method will poll this SWActor's current Location loc to find potential exits, and replaces all the instances of Move in this SWActor's command set with Moves to the new exits.

        This method doesn't affect other non-movement actions in this SWActor's command set.

        Parameters:
        loc - this SWActor's location
